item.title: Rocio add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "But beauty, real beauty, ends where an intellectual expression begins. Intellect is in itself a mode of exaggeration, and destroys the harmony of any face. The moment one sits down to think, one becomes all nose, or all forehead, or something horrid. Look at the successful men in any of the learned professions. How perfectly hideous they are! Except, of course, in the Church. But then in the Church they don't think." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Conscience and cowardice are really the same things, Basil. Conscience is the trade-name of the firm. That is all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The only difference between a caprice and a lifelong passion is that the caprice lasts a little longer." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Humanity takes itself too seriously. It is the world's original sin. If the cave-man had known how to laugh, History would have been different." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "That is one of the great secrets of life Nowadays most people die of a sort of creeping common sense, and discover when it is too late that the only things one never regrets are one's mistakes." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Nowadays people know the price of everything and the value of nothing." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The longer I live, Dorian, the more keenly I feel that whatever was good enough for our fathers is not good enough for us. In art, as in politics, les grand-pères ont toujours tort." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I never approve, or disapprove, of anything now. It is an absurd attitude to take towards life." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "It often happens that the real tragedies of life occur in such an inartistic manner that they hurt us by their crude violence, their absolute incoherence, their absurd want of meaning, their entire lack of style. They affect us just as vulgarity affects us. They give us an impression of sheer brute force, and we revolt against that. Sometimes, however, a tragedy that possesses artistic elements of beauty crosses our lives. If these elements of beauty are real, the whole thing simply appeals to our sense of dramatic effect. Suddenly we find that we are no longer the actors, but the spectators of the play. Or rather we are both. We watch ourselves, and the mere wonder of the spectacle enthralls us." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A man who is master of himself can end a sorrow as easily as he can invent a pleasure." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I love scandals about other people, but scandals about myself do not interest me. The have not got the charm of novelty." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Hacía todo de un modo metódico y parsimonioso, como si no hubiera nada que no estuviera previsto para ella desde su nacimiento." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "Sólo entonces caí en la cuenta de que los vecinos de asiento en los aviones, al igual que los matrimonios viejos, no se dan los buenos días al despertar. Tampoco ella." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Sherrilyn Kenyon
item.description: "When you love someone, truly love them, you lay your heart open to them. You give them a part of yourself that you give to no one else, and you let them inside a part of you that only they can hurt-you literally hand them the razor with a map of where to cut deepest and most painfully on your heart and soul. And when they do strike, it’s crippling-like having your heart carved out." -- Sherrilyn Kenyon

item.title: Rocio add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "And I like large parties. They’re so intimate. At small parties there isn’t any privacy." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Richard Siken
item.description: "You go to work the next day pretending nothing happened. Your co-workers ask if everything's okay and you tell them you're just tired. And you're trying to smile. And they're trying to smile." -- Richard Siken

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Nora Ephron
item.description: "Above all, be the heroine of your life, not the victim." -- Nora Ephron

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Lao Tzu
item.description: "Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage." -- Lao Tzu

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Harper Lee
item.description: "I wanted you to see what real courage is, instead of getting the idea that courage is a man with a gun in his hand. It's when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what. - Atticus Finch" -- Harper Lee

item.title: Rocio add a quote by George R.R. Martin
item.description: "Bran thought about it. 'Can a man still be brave if he's afraid?' 'That is the only time a man can be brave,' his father told him." -- George R.R. Martin

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Have enough courage to trust love one more time and always one more time." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Don't be satisfied with stories, how things have gone with others. Unfold your own myth." -- Rumi

item.title: Rocio add a quote by C. JoyBell C.
item.description: "Don't be afraid of your fears. They're not there to scare you. They're there to let you know that something is worth it." -- C. JoyBell C.

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "There is a stubbornness about me that never can bear to be frightened at the will of others. My courage always rises at every attempt to intimidate me." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "And by the way, everything in life is writable about if you have the outgoing guts to do it, and the imagination to improvise. The worst enemy to creativity is self-doubt." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "If you expect nothing from anybody, you’re never disappointed." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "I have the choice of being constantly active and happy or introspectively passive and sad. Or I can go mad by ricocheting in between." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Rocio add a quote by sylvia plath
item.description: "Perhaps when we find ourselves wanting everything, it is because we are dangerously close to wanting nothing." -- sylvia plath

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Is there no way out of the mind?" -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Rocio add a quote by Paula White
item.description: "Champions have the courage to keep turning the pages because they know a better chapter lies ahead." -- Paula White
